KernelCmdlineConfig.name: kernelcmdlineconfig
KernelCmdlineConfig.description: Append extra arguments to RHEL-8 kernel command line

SELinuxApplyCustom.name: selinuxapplycustom
SELinuxApplyCustom.description:
Re-apply SELinux customizations from RHEL-7 installation

    Re-apply SELinux policy customizations (custom policy modules and changes
    introduced by semanage). Any changes (due to incompatiblity with RHEL-8
    SELinux policy) are reported to user.

VerifyDialogs.name: verify_check_results
VerifyDialogs.description:
Check all dialogs and notify that user needs to make some choices.

    Report messages containing all dialogs with questions that need to be answered will be produced.

EfiCheckBoot.name: efi_check_boot
EfiCheckBoot.description: Adjust EFI boot entry for first reboot

CheckOSRelease.name: check_os_release
CheckOSRelease.description:
Check if the current RHEL minor version is supported. If not, inhibit the upgrade process.

    This check can be skipped by using the LEAPP_DEVEL_SKIP_CHECK_OS_RELEASE environment variable.

SpamassassinConfigUpdate.name: spamassassin_config_update
SpamassassinConfigUpdate.description:
This actor performs several modifications to spamassassin configuration
    so that spamc and the spamassassin systemd service can be run without error
    on the target system:
    1. Remove arguments given to the --ssl option in spamc configuration
       (/etc/mail/spamassassin/spamc.conf).
    2. Remove --ssl-version options from the spamassassin sysconfig file
       (/etc/sysconfig/spamassassin), or replace them with --ssl, if needed.
    3. Remove the -d/--daemonize option from the spamassassin sysconfig file.

    All files are backed up before they are modified.

RemoveOldPAMModulesApply.name: removed_pam_modules_apply
RemoveOldPAMModulesApply.description:
Remove old PAM modules that are no longer available in RHEL-8 from
    PAM configuration to avoid system lock out.

OpenSshConfigScanner.name: read_openssh_config
OpenSshConfigScanner.description:
Collect information about the OpenSSH configuration.

    Currently supporting the following options:

     * PermitRootLogin
     * UsePrivilegeSeparation
     * Protocol
     * Ciphers
     * MACs

SpamassassinConfigCheck.name: spamassassin_config_check
SpamassassinConfigCheck.description:
Reports changes in spamassassin between RHEL-7 and RHEL-8

    Reports backward-incompatible changes that have been made in spamassassin
    between RHEL-7 and RHEL-8 (spamc no longer accepts an argument with the --ssl
    option; spamd no longer accepts the --ssl-version; SSLv3 is no longer supported;
    the type of spamassassin.service has been changed from "forking" to "simple";
    sa-update no longer supports SHA1 validation of rule files).

    The migration of the configuration files will be mostly handled by the
    SpamassassinConfigUpdate actor, however the admin still needs to know about
    the changes so that they can do any necessary migration in places that we cannot
    reach (e.g. scripts).

CheckCPU.name: checkcpu
CheckCPU.description:
Check whether the CPU is supported by the target system. Inhibit upgrade if not.

    Currently we know just about cases with s390x where the set of CPUs supported
    by RHEL 8 is subset of CPUs supported on RHEL 7. We can detect such cases based
    on the machine field inside the /proc/cpuinfo file. expected values of the
    field on supported machines are: 2964, 2965, 3906, 3907.

CheckFirewalld.name: check_firewalld
CheckFirewalld.description: Check for certain firewalld configuration that may prevent an upgrade.

CheckIrssi.name: checkirssi
CheckIrssi.description: Check if irssi is installed. If yes, write information about non-compatible changes.

XFSInfoScanner.name: xfs_info_scanner
XFSInfoScanner.description:
This actor scans all mounted mountpoints for XFS information

    The actor will check each mountpoint reported in the StorageInfo message, if the mountpoint is a partition with XFS
    using ftype = 0. The actor will produce a message with the findings.
    It will contain a list of all XFS mountpoints with ftype = 0 so that those mountpoints can be handled appropriately
    for the overlayfs that is going to be created.

EfiInterimFix.name: efi_interim_fix
EfiInterimFix.description: Adjust EFI boot entry for first reboot

CheckSendmail.name: check_sendmail
CheckSendmail.description:
Check if sendmail is installed, check whether configuration update is needed, inhibit upgrade if TCP wrappers
    are used.

MigrateNtp.name: migrate_ntp
MigrateNtp.description: Migrate ntp and/or ntpdate configuration to chrony.

ReportSetTargetRelease.name: report_set_target_release
ReportSetTargetRelease.description: Reports that a release will be set in the subscription-manager after the upgrade.

IpaScanner.name: ipa_scanner
IpaScanner.description: Scan system for ipa-client and ipa-server status

PersistentNetNamesDisable.name: persistentnetnamesdisable
PersistentNetNamesDisable.description: Disable systemd-udevd persistent network naming on machine with single eth0 NIC

DnfUpgradeTransaction.name: dnf_upgrade_transaction
DnfUpgradeTransaction.description:
Setup and call DNF upgrade command

    Based on previously calculated RPM transaction data, this actor will setup and call
    rhel-upgrade DNF plugin with necessary parameters

CheckSelinux.name: check_se_linux
CheckSelinux.description:
Check SELinux status and produce decision messages for further action.

    Based on SELinux status produces decision messages to relabeling and changing status if
    necessary

Grubdevname.name: grubdevname
Grubdevname.description: Get name of block device where GRUB is located

OpenSshUsePrivilegeSeparationCheck.name: open_ssh_use_privilege_separation
OpenSshUsePrivilegeSeparationCheck.description:
UsePrivilegeSeparation configuration option was removed.

    Check the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation in OpenSSH server config file
    and warn about its deprecation if it is set to non-default value.

SCTPConfigRead.name: sctp_read_status
SCTPConfigRead.description:
Determines whether or not the SCTP kernel module might be wanted.

    This actor determines whether or not the SCTP is currently used by this machine or has been quite
    recently used (1 month timeframe). In case it has been used it will issue a SCTPConfig message that
    defines the decision whether or not the SCTP module should be removed from the module blacklist on RHEL8.

OpenSshPermitRootLoginCheck.name: openssh_permit_root_login
OpenSshPermitRootLoginCheck.description:
OpenSSH no longer allows root logins with password.

    Check the values of PermitRootLogin in OpenSSH server configuration file
    and warn about potential issues after update.

CheckInstalledDevelKernels.name: check_installed_devel_kernels
CheckInstalledDevelKernels.description:
Inhibit IPU (in-place upgrade) when multiple devel kernels are installed.

    Because of an issue in DNF, the transaction can't be validated if there's
    more than one package named kernel-devel. Therefore, in this case, we
    inhibit the upgrade with a clearer remediation.

RemoveUpgradeBootEntry.name: remove_upgrade_boot_entry
RemoveUpgradeBootEntry.description:
Remove boot entry for Leapp provided initramfs.

    After upgrade process used initramfs after reboot, this entry is not necessary anymore.

RemoveSystemdResumeService.name: remove_systemd_resume_service
RemoveSystemdResumeService.description:
Remove systemd service to launch Leapp.

    After system was rebooted and process resumed, this service is not necessary anymore.

PowerTop.name: powertop
PowerTop.description: Check if PowerTOP is installed. If yes, write information about non-compatible changes.

CheckFips.name: check_fips
CheckFips.description: Inhibit upgrade if FIPS is detected as enabled.

InhibitWhenLuks.name: check_luks_and_inhibit
InhibitWhenLuks.description:
Check if any encrypted partitions is in use. If yes, inhibit the upgrade process.

    Upgrading system with encrypted partition is not supported.

CheckRemovedPamModules.name: removed_pam_modules
CheckRemovedPamModules.description:
Check for modules that are not available in RHEL 8 anymore

    At this moment, we check only for pam_tally2. Few more modules
    are alredy covered in RemoveOldPAMModulesApply actor

NetworkManagerUpdateConnections.name: network_manager_update_connections
NetworkManagerUpdateConnections.description:
Update NetworkManager connections.

    When using dhcp=dhclient on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, a non-hexadecimal client-id (a string)
    is sent on the wire as is (i.e. the first character is the 'type' as per RFC 2132 section
    9.14). On Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8, a zero byte is prepended to string-only client-ids. To
    preserve behavior on upgrade, we convert client-ids to the hexadecimal form.

CheckBootAvailSpace.name: check_boot_avail_space
CheckBootAvailSpace.description:
Check if at least 100Mib of available space on /boot. If not, inhibit the upgrade process.

    Rationale for the requirement of 100MiB:
    - Before reboot into initramfs, the CopyInitramfsToBoot actor copies kernel and initramfs to
      /boot, together worth of 66MiB.
    - After booting into initramfs, the RemoveBootFiles actor removes the copied kernel and
      initramfs from /boot.
    - The DnfShellRpmUpgrade installs a new kernel-core package which puts additional 54MiB of data
      to /boot.
    - Even though the available space needed at the time of writing this actor is 66MiB, the
      additional 100-66=34MiB is a leeway for potential growth of the kernel or initramfs in size.

SSSDCheck.name: sssd_check
SSSDCheck.description:
Check SSSD configuration for changes in RHEL8 and report them.

    These changes are:
    - id_provider=local is no longer supported and will be ignored
    - ldap_groups_use_matching_rule_in_chain was removed and will be ignored
    - ldap_initgroups_use_matching_rule_in_chain was removed and will be ignored
    - ldap_sudo_include_regexp changed default from true to false

AuthselectApply.name: authselect_apply
AuthselectApply.description:
Apply changes suggested by AuthselectScanner.

    If confirmed by admin in AuthselectDecision, call suggested authselect
    command to configure the system using this tool.

CheckSkippedRepositories.name: check_skipped_repositories
CheckSkippedRepositories.description:
Produces a report if any repositories enabled on the system are going to be skipped.

    The report produced by this actor should additionally include any package that is affected due to skipping
    the repository.

EnableRHSMReposOnRHEL8.name: enable_rhsm_repos_on_rhel8
EnableRHSMReposOnRHEL8.description:
On the upgraded RHEL 8, set release and enable repositories that were used during the upgrade transaction.

    We are enabling those RHEL 8 repos that are equivalent to the enabled RHEL 7 ones available. The BaseOS and
    AppStream repos are enabled on RHEL 8 by default. Any other repository needs to be enabled specifically using
    the subscription-manager (RHSM) utility. In case some custom repo was used during the upgrade transaction,
    this won't be enabled by this actors as it is unknown to the subscription-manager.

    We need to overwrite any RHSM release that may have been set before the upgrade, e.g. 7.6. Reasons:
    - If we leave the old RHEL 7 release set, dnf calls on the upgraded RHEL 8 would fail.
    - If we merely unset the release, users might end up updating the system to a newer version than the upgrade
      was supposed to be upgrading to.

SCTPConfigUpdate.name: sctp_config_update
SCTPConfigUpdate.description: This actor updates SCTP configuration for RHEL8.

UpdateEtcSysconfigKernel.name: update_etc_sysconfig_kernel
UpdateEtcSysconfigKernel.description:
Update /etc/sysconfig/kernel file.

    In order to proceed with Upgrade process, DEFAULTKERNEL entry should be updated from kernel to
    kernel-core.

NetworkManagerUpdateConfig.name: network_manager_update_config
NetworkManagerUpdateConfig.description:
Updates NetworkManager configuration for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

    On Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 NetworkManager uses the "dhclient" DHCP backend by default, while
    the default is "internal" on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8. We want to keep "dhclient" enabled on
    upgrade, unless the user explicitly chose another backend in the configuration. To do so, we
    drop a configuration snippet in /usr/lib.

CheckWireshark.name: check_wireshark
CheckWireshark.description: Report a couple of changes in tshark usage

ZiplConvertToBLSCFG.name: zipl_convert_to_blscfg
ZiplConvertToBLSCFG.description: Convert the zipl boot loader configuration to the the boot loader specification on s390x systems.

CheckBrltty.name: check_brltty
CheckBrltty.description: Check if brltty is installed, check whether configuration update is needed.

SCTPChecks.name: sctp_checks
SCTPChecks.description:
Parses collected SCTP information and take necessary actions.

    The only action performed by this actor is to request the installation of the
    kernel-modules-extra rpm package, based on if SCTP is being used or not which
    is collected on SCTPConfig message. If yes, it then produces a RpmTransactionTasks
    requesting to install the package.

ForceDefaultBootToTargetKernelVersion.name: force_default_boot_to_target_kernel_version
ForceDefaultBootToTargetKernelVersion.description:
Ensure the default boot entry is set to the new target kernel

    This Actor ensure that the default entry in the boot loader is set to the newly installed kernel version.
    There have been cases when the default boot entry was not set to the default kernel version. In this case the
    actor will log a warning for debugging purposes.

CheckAcpid.name: checkacpid
CheckAcpid.description: Check if acpid is installed. If yes, write information about non-compatible changes.

PamModulesScanner.name: pam_modules_scanner
PamModulesScanner.description:
Scan the pam directory for services and modules used in them

    This produces a PAMConfiguration message containing the whole
    list of configured PAM services and what modules they contain.

AuthselectScanner.name: authselect_scanner
AuthselectScanner.description:
Detect what authselect configuration should be suggested to administrator.

    1. Detect possible authselect profile by looking up modules in PAM
       or by checking that daemon is enabled.
       - pam_sss -> sssd
       - pam_winbind -> winbind
       - ypbind enabled -> nis

       If more then one module/daemon is detected that we will keep the
       configuration intact. No authselect profile can be applied.

    2. Detect authselect profile features by looking up modules in PAM
       or nsswitch.conf.
       - pam_faillock => with-faillock
       - pam_fprintd => with-fingerprint
       - pam_access => with-pamaccess
       - pam_mkhomedir => with-mkhomedir
       - pam_oddjob_mkhomedir => with-mkhomedir

    3. Check if there are any unknown PAM modules.
       If there are used PAM modules not used in authselect (such as pam_ldap),
       we must keep the configuration intact.

    4. Check if authconfig was used to create current configuration.
       If yes, we can automatically convert the configuration to authselect.
       If no, we need admin's confirmation.

       - Check that /etc/sysconfig/authconfig exists.
       - Check that PAM configuration uses authconfig files.
       - Check that PAM configuration was not touch after sysconfig file
         was created.

RedHatSignedRpmCheck.name: red_hat_signed_rpm_check
RedHatSignedRpmCheck.description:
Check if there are packages not signed by Red Hat in use. If yes, warn user about it.

    If any any installed RPM package does not contain a valid signature from Red Hat, a message
    containing a warning is produced.

PersistentNetNames.name: persistentnetnames
PersistentNetNames.description:
Get network interface information for physical ethernet interfaces of the original system.

    Gather information like PCI topology, MAC address and interface name on the
    original system. Those data are provided through the PersistentNetNamesFacts
    model.

    See the persistentnetnamesinitramfs actor that is very same but processed
    during early phases in initrams to gather the same data but using already
    new kernel of the target system to be able to reflect changes affected
    by the new kernel (see the PersistentNetNamesConfig actor).

OpenSshProtocolCheck.name: open_ssh_protocol
OpenSshProtocolCheck.description:
Protocol configuration option was removed.

    Check the value of Protocol in OpenSSH server config file
    and warn about its deprecation if it is set. This option was removed
    in RHEL 7.4, but it might still be hanging around.

TcpWrappersCheck.name: tcp_wrappers_check
TcpWrappersCheck.description:
Check the list of packages previously compiled with TCP wrappers support
    and check whether they have some rules configured in
    /etc/hosts.{allow,deny} that are no longer honored by the daemons and
    might make the service more accessible than expected.

CheckNfs.name: check_nfs
CheckNfs.description:
Check if NFS filesystem is in use. If yes, inhibit the upgrade process.

    Actor looks for NFS in the following sources: /ets/fstab, mount and systemd-mount.
    If there is NFS in any of the mentioned sources, actors inhibits the upgrade.

CheckRootSymlinks.name: check_root_symlinks
CheckRootSymlinks.description:
Check if the symlinks /bin and /lib are relative, not absolute.

    After reboot, dracut fails if the links are absolute.

UpdateGrubCore.name: update_grub_core
UpdateGrubCore.description:
On legacy (BIOS) systems, GRUB core (located in the gap between the MBR and the
    first partition), does not get automatically updated when GRUB is upgraded.

ScanInstalledTargetKernelVersion.name: scan_installed_target_kernel_version
ScanInstalledTargetKernelVersion.description:
Scan for the version of the newly installed kernel

    This actor will query rpm for all kernel packages and reports the first matching el8 kernel RPM version.

PreparePythonWorkround.name: prepare_python_workround
PreparePythonWorkround.description:
Prepare environment to be able to run leapp with Python3 in initrd.

    These are the current necessary steps to be able to run Leapp with Python3.
    Basically, we create directory (now /root/tmp_leapp_py3/). We will put
    symlinks inside which will point to leapp python packages. Additionally,
    we create new script that will import expected modules and run leapp again.

UdevAdmInfo.name: udevadm_info
UdevAdmInfo.description: Produces data exported by the "udevadm info" command.

UnsupportedUpgradeCheck.name: unsupported_upgrade_check
UnsupportedUpgradeCheck.description:
Checks enviroment variables and produces a warning report if the upgrade is unsupported.

    Upgrade is unsupported if any LEAPP_DEVEL_* variable is used or an experimental actor is enabled.
    This can be overridden by setting the variable LEAPP_UNSUPPORTED (at user's own risk).

NetworkManagerUpdateService.name: network_manager_update_service
NetworkManagerUpdateService.description:
Updates NetworkManager services status.

    On Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 if the NetworkManager service was disabled and
    NetworkManager-wait-online enabled, the former would not be started. This changed on Red Hat
    Enterprise Linux 8, where NM-w-o 'Requires' NM and so NM can be started even if disabled. Upon
    upgrade, to keep the previous behavior we must disable NM-w-o when NM is disabled.

    See also:
      https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1520865

PythonInformUser.name: python_inform_user
PythonInformUser.description: This actor informs the user of differences in Python version and support in RHEL 8.

CheckSkipPhase.name: check_skip_phase
CheckSkipPhase.description:
Skip all the subsequent phases until the report phase.

    The phases that follow after the Checks phase work with the target (RHEL 8)
    user space - stuff around preparing and checking the rpm transaction.
    We do not want to process those phases in case of inhibition - e.g. for
    a specific HW unsupported by the target system we cannot do anything - we
    can just see some unclear errors in such case. So we want to instead skip
    to the Reports phase to provide clear report to user without confusing
    errors.

    The actor is processed after all actors in the phase (that provides Report
    messages) are processed.

SELinuxContentScanner.name: selinuxcontentscanner
SELinuxContentScanner.description:
Scan the system for any SELinux customizations

    Find SELinux policy customizations (custom policy modules and changes
    introduced by semanage) and save them in SELinuxModules and SELinuxCustom
    models. Customizations that are incompatible with SELinux policy on RHEL-8
    are removed.

TransactionWorkarounds.name: transaction_workarounds
TransactionWorkarounds.description:
Provides additional RPM transaction tasks based on bundled RPM packages.

    After collecting bundled RPM packages, a message with relevant data will be produced.

DetectGrubConfigError.name: detect_grub_config_error
DetectGrubConfigError.description: Check grub configuration for syntax error in GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX value.

SanebackendsMigrate.name: sanebackends_migrate
SanebackendsMigrate.description:
Actor for migrating sane-backends configuration files.

    Adds USB quirks for support specific USB scanners if they
    are not added during package manager transaction.

CheckMemory.name: checkmemory
CheckMemory.description:
The actor check the size of RAM against RHEL8 minimal hardware requirements

    Using the following resource: https://access.redhat.com/articles/rhel-limits

CheckMemcached.name: check_memcached
CheckMemcached.description:
Check for incompatible changes in memcached configuration.

    Warn that memcached in RHEL8 no longer listens on the UDP port by default
    and the default service configuration binds memcached to the loopback
    interface.

ScanKernelCmdline.name: scan_kernel_cmdline
ScanKernelCmdline.description: No documentation has been provided for the scan_kernel_cmdline actor.

components.description: PAM module pam_pkcs11 is no longer available in RHEL-8 since it was replaced by SSSD.
components.label: Disable pam_pkcs11 module in PAM configuration? If no, the upgrade process will be interrupted.
components.reason: Leaving this module in PAM configuration may lock out the system.

components.description: PAM module pam_krb5 is no longer available in RHEL-8 since it was replaced by SSSD.
components.label: Disable pam_krb5 module in PAM configuration? If no, the upgrade process will be interrupted.
components.reason: Leaving this module in PAM configuration may lock out the system.

RemoveOldPAMModulesCheck.name: removed_pam_modules_check
RemoveOldPAMModulesCheck.description:
Check if it is all right to disable PAM modules that are not in RHEL-8.

    If admin will refuse to disable these modules (pam_pkcs11 and pam_krb5),
    upgrade will be stopped. Otherwise we would risk locking out the system
    once these modules are removed.

CheckRedHatSubscriptionManagerSKU.name: check_rhsmsku
CheckRedHatSubscriptionManagerSKU.description:
Ensure the system is subscribed to the subscription manager

    This actor verifies that the system is correctly subscribed to via the Red Hat Subscription Manager and
    has attached SKUs. The actor will inhibit the upgrade if there are none.

MultipathConfCheck.name: multipath_conf_check
MultipathConfCheck.description:
Checks whether the multipath configuration can be updated to RHEL-8.
    Specifically, it checks if the path_checker/checker option is set to
    something other than tur in the defaults section. If so, non-trivial
    changes may be required in the multipath.conf file, and it is not
    possible to auto-update it.

VsftpdConfigRead.name: vsftpd_config_read
VsftpdConfigRead.description: Reads vsftpd configuration files (/etc/vsftpd/*.conf) and extracts necessary information.

EfiFinalizationFix.name: efi_finalization_fix
EfiFinalizationFix.description: Adjust EFI boot entry for final reboot

PesEventsScanner.name: pes_events_scanner
PesEventsScanner.description:
Provides data about packages events from Package Evolution Service.

    After collecting data from a provided JSON file containing Package Evolution Service events, a
    message with relevant data will be produced to help DNF Upgrade transaction calculation.

VsftpdConfigUpdate.name: vsftpd_config_update
VsftpdConfigUpdate.description:
Modifies vsftpd configuration files on the target RHEL-8 system so that the effective
    configuration is the same, where possible. This means doing two things:
    1. Reverting the default configuration file (/etc/vsftpd/vsftpd.conf) to its state
       before the upgrade (where it makes sense), if the configuration file was being used
       with its default content (i.e., unmodified) on the source system (the configuration
       file gets replaced with a new version during the RPM upgrade in this case).
       The anonymous_enable option falls in this category.
    2. Adding 'option=old_effective_value' to configuration files for options whose default
       value has changed, if the option is not explicitly specified in the configuration file.
       The strict_ssl_read_eof option falls in this category.
    3. Disabling options that cannot be enabled, otherwise vsftpd wouldn't work.
       The tcp_wrappers option falls in this category.

RedHatSignedRpmScanner.name: red_hat_signed_rpm_scanner
RedHatSignedRpmScanner.description:
Provides data about installed RPM Packages signed by Red Hat.

    After filtering the list of installed RPM packages by signature, a message with relevant data
    will be produced.

CheckInstalledKernels.name: check_installed_kernels
CheckInstalledKernels.description:
Inhibit IPU (in-place upgrade) when installed kernels conflict with a safe upgrade.

    a) Inhibit when multiple kernels are installed on a s390x machine

    When on s390x architecture, we are not able to upgrade correctly
    when any kernel is expected to be uninstalled during the rpm
    upgrade transaction now. We discovered recently that removal of
    old kernels is not handled correctly during the IPU. In case the
    maximum number of kernels are installed, the oldest one is
    automatically uninstalled during the rpm upgrade transaction.

    To prevent any related troubles during the IPU, inhibit the IPU
    on s390x unless just one kernel is installed, until the issue will
    be fixed correctly.

    b) Inhibit when machine is not booted into latest installed kernel

    It is strictly required that during the upgrade the machine is
    booted into the latest installed kernel. Upgrading with older
    kernels could cause unexpected issues.

RemoveLeftoverPackages.name: remove_leftover_packages
RemoveLeftoverPackages.description:
Remove el7 packages left on the system after the upgrade to RHEL 8.

    Removal of el7 packages is necessary in order to keep the machine in supported state.
    Actor generates report telling users what packages have been removed.

CheckSystemArch.name: check_system_arch
CheckSystemArch.description:
Check if system is running at a supported architecture. If no, inhibit the upgrade process.

    Base on collected system facts, verify if current architecture is supported, otherwise produces
    a message to inhibit upgrade process

CheckGrep.name: checkgrep
CheckGrep.description: Check if Grep is installed. If yes, write information about non-compatible changes.

VimMigrate.name: vim_migrate
VimMigrate.description:
Modify configuration files of Vim 8.0 and later to keep the same behavior
    as Vim 7.4 and earlier had.

InitrdInclude.name: initrdinclude
InitrdInclude.description: Regenerate RHEL-8 initrd and include files produced by other actors

CupsfiltersMigrate.name: cupsfilters_migrate
CupsfiltersMigrate.description:
Actor for migrating package cups-filters.

    Migrating cups-filters package means adding two directives into
    /etc/cups/cups-browsed.conf - LocalQueueNamingRemoteCUPS and
    CreateIPPPrinterQueues.

    LocalQueueNamingRemoteCUPS directive indicates what will be used as a name
    for local print queue creation - the default is DNS-SD ID of advertised
    print queue now, it was the name of remote print queue in the past.

    CreateIPPPrinterQueues directive serves for telling cups-browsed to create
    local print queues for all available IPP printers.

SystemFactsActor.name: system_facts

NetworkManagerReadConfig.name: network_manager_read_config
NetworkManagerReadConfig.description:
Provides data about NetworkManager configuration.

    After collecting data from NetworkManager tool, a message with relevant data will be produced.

ReportLeftoverPackages.name: report_leftover_packages
ReportLeftoverPackages.description:
Collect messages about leftover el7 packages and generate report for users.

    Depending on execution of previous actors, generated report contains information that there are still el7 packages
    present on the system, which makes it unsupported or lists packages that have been removed.

MultipathConfRead.name: multipath_conf_read
MultipathConfRead.description:
Reads multipath configuration files (multipath.conf, and any files in
    the multipath config directory) and extracts the necessary information

SetPermissiveSelinux.name: set_permissive_se_linux
SetPermissiveSelinux.description:
Set SELinux mode.

    In order to proceed with Upgrade process, SELinux should be set into permissive mode if it was
    in enforcing mode.

CheckKdeApps.name: check_kde_apps
CheckKdeApps.description: Actor checks which KDE apps are installed.

CreateSystemdResumeService.name: create_systemd_service
CreateSystemdResumeService.description:
Add a systemd service to launch Leapp.

    Create a systemd service which will resume Leapp upgrade after the first reboot.

TargetUserspaceCreator.name: target_userspace_creator
TargetUserspaceCreator.description:
Initializes a directory to be populated as a minimal environment to run binaries from the target system.

    The target userspace is set up in a directory so one can run it in a containerized environment to perform tasks
    as if the system running would be the target system. This allows us to use the target system RPM stack including
    DNF which gives us the ability to use RPM features from the target system.
    The userspace environment is also used to generate a initram disk with dracut using the target system binaries
    such as kernel, systemd etc etc

CheckNtp.name: check_ntp
CheckNtp.description: Check if ntp and/or ntpdate configuration needs to be migrated.

MultipathConfUpdate.name: multipath_conf_update
MultipathConfUpdate.description:
Modifies multipath configuration files on the target RHEL-8 system so that
    they will run properly. This is done in three ways
    1. commenting out lines for options that no longer exist, or whose value
       is no longer current in RHEL-8
    2. Migrating any options in an devices section with all_devs to an
       overrides setions
    3. Rename options that have changed names

SELinuxPrepare.name: selinuxprepare
SELinuxPrepare.description:
Remove selinux policy customizations before updating selinux-policy* packages

    RHEL-7 policy customizations could cause policy package upgrade to fail and therefore
    need to be removed. Customizations introduced by semanage are removed first,
    followed by custom policy modules gathered by SELinuxContentScanner.

PCIDevicesScanner.name: pci_devices_scanner
PCIDevicesScanner.description:
Provides data about existing PCI Devices.

    After collecting data from lspci, a message with relevant data will be produced.

RemoveBootFiles.name: remove_boot_files
RemoveBootFiles.description:
Remove Leapp provided initramfs from boot partition.

    Since Leapp provided initramfs and kernel are already loaded into RAM at this phase, remove
    them to have as little space requirements for boot partition as possible.

components.description: If yes, suggested authselect profile will be applied on your system to generate PAM and nsswitch.conf configuration. If no, current configuration will be kept intact.
components.label: Configure PAM and nsswitch.conf with the following authselect call?
components.reason: There is a new tool called authselect in RHEL8 that replaced authconfig which is used to manage authentication (PAM) and identity (nsswitch.conf) sources. It is recommended to switch to this tool.

AuthselectCheck.name: authselect_check
AuthselectCheck.description:
Confirm suggested authselect call from AuthselectScanner.

    AuthselectScanner produces an Authselect model that contains changes
    that are suggested based on current configuration. This actor will
    ask administrator for confirmation and will report the result.

RpmScanner.name: rpm_scanner
RpmScanner.description:
Provides data about installed RPM Packages.

    After collecting data from RPM query, a message with relevant data will be produced.

StorageScanner.name: storage_scanner
StorageScanner.description:
Provides data about storage settings.

    After collecting data from tools like mount, lsblk, pvs, vgs and lvdisplay, and relevant files
    under /proc/partitions and /etc/fstab, a message with relevant data will be produced.

CheckDosfstools.name: checkdosfstools
CheckDosfstools.description: Check if dosfstools is installed. If yes, write information about non-compatible changes.

CheckKernelDrivers.name: check_kernel_drivers
CheckKernelDrivers.description:
Actor checks if any loaded RHEL7 kernel driver is missing in the RHEL8.
    If yes, the upgrade process will be inhibited.

    Inhibition is done because missing kernel driver on the RHEL8 system may
    mean that the hardware using such driver would not work on the RHEL8.

    Note:
     - List of kernel drivers missing on the RHEL8 system is located in the
        files/removed_drivers.txt file.

CheckKdeGnome.name: check_kde_gnome
CheckKdeGnome.description:
Checks whether KDE is installed

    Actor will check whether KDE is installed together with GNOME desktop to inform whether we can
    inhibit the upgrade process. When both are installed, we need to inform the user that KDE will
    be removed and GNOME will be used instead. If only KDE is installed, we want to inhibit
    the upgrade process otherwise the user will end up without a desktop.
    Note: The Package Evolution Service data makes sure the KDE-related packages are removed in the
    dnf upgrade transaction.

GetInstalledDesktops.name: get_installed_desktops
GetInstalledDesktops.description:
Actor checks if kde or gnome desktop environments
    are installed and what desktop is default.

SetupTargetRepos.name: setuptargetrepos
SetupTargetRepos.description:
Produces list of repositories that should be available to be used by Upgrade process.

    Based on current set of Red Hat Enterprise Linux repositories, produces the list of target
    repositories. Additionaly process request to use custom repositories during the upgrade
    transaction.

FirewalldUpdateLockdownWhitelist.name: firewalld_update_lockdown_whitelist
FirewalldUpdateLockdownWhitelist.description:
Update the firewalld Lockdown Whitelist.

    RHEL-8 uses a platform specific python interpreter for packaged
    applications. For firewall-config, the interpreter path is part of the
    lockdown list. In RHEL-7 this was simply /usr/bin/python, but in RHEL-8
    it's /usr/libexec/platform-python. However, if the user made changes to the
    lockdown whitelist it won't be replaced by RPM/dnf. As such we must update
    the interpreter if the old value is there.

CheckBtrfs.name: check_btrfs
CheckBtrfs.description:
Check if Btrfs filesystem is in use. If yes, inhibit the upgrade process.

    Btrfs filesystem was introduced as Technology Preview with initial releases of RHEL 6 and 7. It
    was deprecated on versions 6.6 and 7.4 and will not be present in next major version.

RootScanner.name: root_scanner
RootScanner.description:
Scan the system root directory and produce a message containing
    information about its subdirectories.

DnfPackageDownload.name: dnf_package_download
DnfPackageDownload.description:
Actor that invokes DNF to download the RPMs required for the upgrade transaction.

    This actor uses the rhel-upgrade plugin to perform the download of RPM for the transaction and performing the
    transaction test, that is something like a dry run trying to determine the success of the upgrade.

DnfTransactionCheck.name: dnf_transaction_check
DnfTransactionCheck.description: This actor tries to solve the RPM transaction to verify the all package dependencies can be successfully resolved.

PersistentNetNamesInitramfs.name: persistentnetnamesinitramfs
PersistentNetNamesInitramfs.description:
Get network interface information for physical ethernet interfaces with the new kernel in initramfs.

    This actor does exactly the same job as PersistentNetNames actor except that it runs in a later phase.

PersistentNetNamesConfig.name: persistentnetnamesconfig
PersistentNetNamesConfig.description:
Generate udev persistent network naming configuration

    This actor generates systemd-udevd link files for each physical ethernet interface present on RHEL-7
    in case we notice that interace name differs on RHEL-8. Link file configuration will assign RHEL-7 version of
    a name. Actors produces list of interfaces which changed name between RHEL-7 and RHEL-8.

VsftpdConfigCheck.name: vsftpd_config_check
VsftpdConfigCheck.description:
Checks whether the vsftpd configuration is supported in RHEL-8. Namely checks that
    configuration files don't set tcp_wrappers=YES and vsftpd-related configuration is
    not present in tcp_wrappers configuration files at the same time.

NSSGlibcCheckActor.name: nss_glibc_check_actor
NSSGlibcCheckActor.description: There has been no description provided for this actor.

ScheduleSeLinuxRelabeling.name: schedule_se_linux_relabelling
ScheduleSeLinuxRelabeling.description:
Schedule SELinux relabelling.

    If SELinux status was set to permissive or enforcing, a relabelling is necessary.

Checkhacluster.name: check_ha_cluster
Checkhacluster.description:
Check if HA Cluster is in use. If yes, inhibit the upgrade process.

    The system is considered as part of cluster if a corosync.conf file
    (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf) can be found there.
    Also the system can be a part of a cluster as a remote node. In such case
    a cib file (/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/cib.xml) can be found there.

Biosdevname.name: biosdevname
Biosdevname.description: Enable biosdevname on RHEL8 if all interfaces on RHEL7 use biosdevname naming scheme and if machine vendor is DELL

ScanSubscriptionManagerInfo.name: scan_subscription_manager_info
ScanSubscriptionManagerInfo.description:
Scans the current system for subscription manager information

    Retrieves information about enabled and available repositories, attached SKUs, product certificates and release
    from the current system without modfying it.

SpamassassinConfigRead.name: spamassassin_config_read
SpamassassinConfigRead.description:
Reads spamc configuration (/etc/mail/spamassassin/spamc.conf), the
    spamassassin sysconfig file (/etc/sysconfig/spamassassin) and checks
    whether the spamassassin service has been overriden. Produces
    SpamassassinFacts containing the extracted information.

Prepareyumconfig.name: prepareyumconfig
Prepareyumconfig.description:
Handle migration of the yum configuration files.

    RPM cannot handle replacement of directories by symlinks by default
    without the %pretrans scriptlet. As yum package is packaged wrong,
    we have to workround that by migration of the yum configuration files
    before the rpm transaction is processed.

VerifyCheckResults.name: verify_check_results
VerifyCheckResults.description:
Check all generated results messages and notify user about them.

    A report file containing all messages will be generated, together with log messages displayed
    to the user.

FilterRpmTransactionTasks.name: check_rpm_transaction_events
FilterRpmTransactionTasks.description:
Filter RPM transaction events based on installed RPM packages

    In order to calculate a working DNF Upgrade transaction, Leapp can collect data from multiple
    sources and find workarounds for possible problems. This actor will filter all collected
    workarounds and keep only those relevants to current system based on installed packages.

CheckIPAServer.name: check_ipa_server
CheckIPAServer.description: Check for ipa-server and inhibit upgrade

InitramDiskGenerator.name: initram_disk_generator
InitramDiskGenerator.description:
Creates the upgrade initram disk

    Creates an initram disk within a systemd-nspawn container using the target system userspace, including new kernel.
    The creation of the initram disk can be influenced with RequiredUpgradeInitramPackages and UpgradeDracutModule,
    which allow to specify additional packages to install in the target userspace and dracut modules to be included
    during the dracut execution.

UsedRepositoriesScanner.name: used_repository_scanner
UsedRepositoriesScanner.description:
Scan used enabled repositories

    Based on lists of installed RPM packages and enabled RPM repositories, check which packages
    were installed from each repository.

RpmTransactionConfigTasksCollector.name: rpm_transaction_config_tasks_collector
RpmTransactionConfigTasksCollector.description:
Provides additional RPM transaction tasks from /etc/leapp/transaction.

    After collecting task data from /etc/leapp/transaction directory, a message with relevant data
    will be produced.

RepositoriesMapping.name: repository_mapping
RepositoriesMapping.description: Produces message containing repository mapping based on provided file.

SSSDFacts.name: sssd_facts
SSSDFacts.description:
Check SSSD configuration for changes in RHEL8 and report them in model.

    These changes are:
    - id_provider=local is no longer supported and will be ignored
    - ldap_groups_use_matching_rule_in_chain was removed and will be ignored
    - ldap_initgroups_use_matching_rule_in_chain was removed and will be ignored
    - ldap_sudo_include_regexp changed default from true to false

CheckLeftoverPackages.name: check_leftover_packages
CheckLeftoverPackages.description:
Check if there are any RHEL 7 packages present after upgrade.

    Actor produces message containing these packages. Message is empty if there are no el7 package left.

CheckChrony.name: check_chrony
CheckChrony.description:
Check for incompatible changes in chrony configuration.

    Warn that the default chrony configuration in RHEL8 uses the leapsectz
    directive.

AddUpgradeBootEntry.name: add_upgrade_boot_entry
AddUpgradeBootEntry.description:
Add new boot entry for Leapp provided initramfs.

    Using new boot entry, Leapp can continue the upgrade process in the initramfs after reboot

CheckPostfix.name: check_postfix
CheckPostfix.description: Check if postfix is installed, check whether configuration update is needed.

RepositoriesBlacklist.name: repositories_blacklist
RepositoriesBlacklist.description: Generate list of repository IDs that should be ignored by Leapp during upgrade process

CommonLeappDracutModules.name: common_leapp_dracut_modules
CommonLeappDracutModules.description:
Influences the generation of the initram disk

    The initram disk generation is influenced by specifying necessary dracut modules and packages that are
    required to be installed in the target userspace so required fields can be included.
    Modules to be added are specified via the UpgradeDracutModule message.
    Packages to install on the target userspace are specified by the RequiredUpgradeInitramPackages message.

RemoveOldPAMModulesScanner.name: removed_pam_modules_scanner
RemoveOldPAMModulesScanner.description:
Scan PAM configuration for modules that are not available in RHEL-8.

    PAM module pam_krb5 and pam_pkcs11 are no longer present in RHEL-8
    and must be removed from PAM configuration, otherwise it may lock out
    the system.

FirewalldFactsActor.name: firewalld_facts_actor
FirewalldFactsActor.description:
Provide data about firewalld

    After collecting data, a message with relevant data will be produced.

CheckGrubCore.name: check_grub_core
CheckGrubCore.description: Check whether we are on legacy (BIOS) system and instruct Leapp to upgrade GRUB core

OpenSshAlgorithmsCheck.name: open_ssh_algorithms
OpenSshAlgorithmsCheck.description:
OpenSSH configuration does not contain any unsupported cryptographic algorithms.

    Check the values of Ciphers and MACs in OpenSSH server config file and warn
    about removed algorithms which might cause the server to fail to start.

IPUWorkflow.name: InplaceUpgrade
IPUWorkflow.description: The IPU workflow takes care of an in-place upgrade (IPU) of RHEL 7 to RHEL 8.
